intro: Eritrichium qofengense, commonly known as the Qofeng alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of high altitudes. It has small, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Eritrichium qofengense is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native region.
